title: Essex lorry deaths: Police move 11 bodies to nearby hospital for post-mortems
text:

The bodies of 39 migrants found dead in a container in Essex yesterday have begun to be moved to a nearby hospital.

A police escort accompanied 11 of the Chinese nationals to a nearby hospital.

They are thought to have frozen to death in a refrigerated container and were found on an industrial estate in Grays, Essex, in the early hours of Wednesday.

The next stages will be for post-mortem examinations to be carried out to determine the cause of death for the migrants who arrived at Purfleet from Zeebrugge in Belgium on Tuesday.

Essex Police, currently leading one of the biggest murder investigations in UK history, hope to have all of the bodies recovered from the lorry before the weekend.

Get live updates on all the developments regarding the investigation on our live blog

(Image: Getty Images)

The bodies are being transported under police escort by private ambulance from the Port of Tilbury to Broomfield Hospital in Chelmsford.

In a statement released this evening Essex Police said: "The first 11 victims are being transporter under police escort by private ambulance from the Port of Tilbury to Broomfield Hospital in Chelmsford having left the port at 7.41pm.

"The process of victim recovery under the DVI process is likely to take some time.

"The next stages will be for post-mortem examinations to be carried out."

Earlier today detectives were granted an additional 24 hours to quiz lorry driver Mo Robinson, 25, who was arrested on suspicion of murder shortly after the bodies were found,

The discovery of the 39 bodies has been described as a 'very dark day' for the town of Grays.

Thurrock Councillor James Halden said the discovery on Wednesday was "devastating".

"Yesterday was a very, very dark day in the history of our borough but not one that will undermine this magnificent community," he told reporters today.

(Image: PA)

Mr Halden spoke before he signed a book of condolences for the victims, along with the Thurrock mayor and Essex Police officers.

"Let's be clear this is an appalling crime," he said.

"It challenges our understanding of humanity."
description: The bodies of 39 Chinese nationals found in Grays, Essex, have been held in a secure location since Wednesday evening
